description: From Middle English leem, leme, leam, from Old English lēoma (“light, brightness”); akin to light.

entries.meaning: (obsolete) A ray or glimmer of light; a gleam.
examples: Thereby the incomprehensible majestie of God, as it were by a bright leme of a torch or candle, is declared to the blinde inhabitants of this world.

verbs.description: leme (third-person singular simple present lemes, present participle leming, simple past and past participle lemed)
